column1: 1. Who were the most powerful of the ancient civilizations of the Americas?
2. How many people did the Incas rule?
3. About when did the Incan civilization exist?

column2: They existed in the Andes Mountains, which is on the western edge of South America.

column1: 5. What did Incas build on the mountains to help them farm?

column2: chili peppers, squash, beans, cotton, peanuts, corn, and over 200 varieties of potatoes

column1: 7. What did Incas believe about the sun?
column2: Incas believed they were descendants of the sun god, Inti.

column1: 8. Could Incas improve their lives through hard work?
column2: No. They were born either commoners or nobles.

column1: 9. What did commoners have to do throughout their lives?
column2: Commoners had to serve the government by building, working on farms, and serving in the military.

column1: 10. What is the most well-known Incan city?
